metadata.Title: CVE-2018-18494 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A same-origin policy violation allowing the theft of cross-origin URL entries when using the Javascript location property to cause a redirection to another site using performance.getEntries(). This is a same-origin policy violation and could allow for data theft. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 60.4, Firefox ESR < 60.4, and Firefox < 64.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-18494` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 64.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 64.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 64.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 64.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required
